abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Power Transmission Project in
            Indonesia. The overall objective of the project was to
            expand, strengthen and upgrade the transmission facilities
            for the Java-Bali system to supply electricity to new
            consumers and to meet increases in electricity demand
            arising from existing and new consumers. Both the
            Bank's and the Borrower's performance under the
            project has generally been satisfactory.The key lessons
            learned were as follows : (i) establishment of a central
            Project Management Unit (PMU) could benefit overall project
            coordination and accountability; (ii) cumbersome procurement
            processes are a leading cause of project implementation
            delays; (iii) action on land acquisition should be taken
            early on during project preparation stage; (iv) the project
            did not have any outcome or impact indicators to measure the
            performance of State Electrcitv Corporation’s (PLN) power
            transmission system in Java; (v) the project's focus on
            institutional development solely through a system planning
            study can in hindsight be viewed as overly narrow; and (vi)
            more attention should be given on accurate cost estimate.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Transmission Project will
            support the development of the power sector and help provide
            reliable and efficient supply of electric power.  It will:
            (a) expand, strengthen and upgrade the transmission
            facilities for the Java-Bali system to supply electricity to
            new consumers, and to meet increases in electricity demand
            arising from existing and new consumers; and (b) provide
            project support technical assistance, including consulting
            services for (i) the engineering, design and construction
            supervision of transmission facilities included in the
            project, (ii) the engineering, design and construction
            supervision of additional generating units at the Suralaya
            coal-fired thermal power station in West Java, (iii) a site
            selection and feasibility study for a new thermal power
            plant in West Java, and (iv) a study for the long-term
            development of the transmission network for the Java-Bali system.
